intro: Phyllanthus guangdongensis, commonly known as Guangdong phyllanthus, is a flowering plant species native to southern China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, glossy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its botanical features include a short, branched stem and yellowish-green flowers that are often surrounded by specialized bracts. Phyllanthus guangdongensis is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
